text:

name: sfchronicle
text:
Here are 8 Chinese dishes that Bay Area legend Cecilia Chiang helped popularize, plus recommendations from critic Soleil Ho (@hooleil) on where to find modern versions.

https://t.co/cpvUaiESLV

name: sfchronicle
text:
Patients have a right to tell their doctors what kind of treatment they want, said Albert Jonsen, and doctors have an obligation to listen.

Jonsen, one of the founding scholars of the field of bioethics, died Oct. 21 in his S.F. home. He was 89. 

https://t.co/QpTte3P4WN

name: sfchronicle
text:
Bicyclists long dreaming of turning San Francisco’s main drag into Amsterdam may not get promised protected bike lanes as the Better Market Street project gets scaled back in yet another pandemic hit.

Story by @MalloryMoench: https://t.co/nSTtw6swCr

name: sfchronicle
text:
Karl Bracy, a Black man from Fairfield, filed a federal civil rights lawsuit against the city of San Rafael and four police officers, claiming wrongful detention and excessive use of force.

https://t.co/bDch9PTHyR

name: sfchronicle
text: “If you’re committed to working against climate change, I think it might be impossible to make a $21 bottle of wine anywhere.” https://t.co/lPiquQBYTK

name: sfchronicle
text: The University of California, which has stopped requiring applicants to take the SAT or the ACT, cannot allow prospective students to submit their scores on the standardized tests, a state appeals court said in a victory for students with disabilities. https://t.co/RyHGfUzduz

name: sfchronicle
text:
Bay Area residents have been using their yards to express both their festive spirit and frustrations about 2020 and the horrors it has brought upon us.

Use the hashtags #HalloweenSF and #TotalSF to share your photos with us. https://t.co/JKrvQurCIr

name: sfchronicle
text: California is a place for a dialogue. But in 2020, it doesn’t appear to be a place for action. This is the most confounding part of the ongoing racial awakening, writes @JustMrPhillips. https://t.co/QsjAMA9RZY
